author: Editor
content: A study led by Wynn Legon at the Fralin Biomedical Research Institute suggests that noninvasive brain stimulation can relieve pain. Their research, published in PAIN, shows that focused ultrasound on the brain's insula can reduce pain perception and related effects like changes in heart rate.
title: Ultrasound relieves deep brain pain

author: Editor
content: A new research led by Johns Hopkins University suggests that, what was once believed to be sound waves from a meteor fireball in 2014 near Papua New Guinea may have been vibrations from a passing truck on a nearby road. This discovery challenges the belief that the materials retrieved from the ocean were extraterrestrial materials from that meteor.
title: Interstellar signal linked to aliens was just a truck

author: Editor
content: In a recent study, researchers from MIT investigated how a certain treatment could benefit mice with Alzheimer's disease. They found that this technique aids in the removal of amyloid proteins from the brain, which play a major role in the pathogenicity of Alzheimer's disease. The technique uses the brain's glymphatic system.
title: Gamma rhythm stimulation: Clearing Amyloid in Alzheimer’s mice

author: Editor
content: Scientists have identified a population of objects that appear as little red dots in JWST images. They also demonstrated that these objects are SMBHs but not overly massive ones. Identifying Hα spectrum emission lines with broad line profiles was crucial for proving that these objects are supermassive black holes.
title: Webb detected little giants in the deep past

author: Swati Dubey
content: Global ocean temperatures reached a record high in February, hitting 21.06°C, according to the EU's Copernicus Climate Change Service on Thursday. This surpassed the previous record of 20.98°C set in August 2023, in a dataset spanning back to 1979. The record also coincides with the month being declared the hottest February ever on record.
title: Ocean temperature hit record high in February 2024

author: Ashley Paul
content: Cambridge and Cardiff universities' researchers have found the world's oldest "fossil forest" in South West England. The fossilised trees' trunks were hollow and thin and the trees themselves lacked leaves and were instead covered in twig-like structures. The trees were up to four metres long and can be used to reconstruct the fossil forests using their "footprints", a researcher said.
title: World's oldest fossil forest discovered in England, video surfaces

author: Ashley Paul
content: Scientists have spotted the oldest "dead" galaxy ever observed using James Webb Space Telescope in one of its deepest view of the distant universe. The galaxy, named JADES-GS-z7-01-QU, existed when the universe was about 700 million years into its current age of 13.8 billion years. An unexplained phenomenon made the galaxy suddenly halt star formation.
title: Oldest 'dead' galaxy seen in one of the deepest views of universe

author: Anmol Sharma
content: An acute subdural hematoma (SDH) is a form of traumatic brain injury wherein a clot of blood develops between surface of the brain and the dura mater, the brain’s tough outer covering. It results from tears in bridging veins. Symptoms of acute SDH include severe headache, weakness on one side of the body, seizures and changes in vision or speech.
title: What is an acute subdural hematoma?

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Artificial reefs composed of recycled cement from construction sites and steel were installed in the Arabian Sea near Mumbai's Worli Koliwada on Thursday. Under the project, 210 reefs were installed at a cost of ₹62 lakh. The reefs are expected to enhance local fisheries, create new fishing opportunities and act as a carbon sink.
title: 210 artificial reefs worth ₹62 lakh installed near Mumbai coast

author: The Hawk Editor
content: India approves a Rs 10,372 crore AI mission for five years, announced by Union Minister Piyush Goyal. The fund will boost computing infrastructure and AI development, offering over 10,000 GPU supercomputing capacity to startups, academia, and the industry. A National Data Management Officer will enhance data quality for AI advancements.
title: Cabinet approves Rs 10,372 Crore AI mission for next 5 years
